decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly get creatures with infect on the board, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, and use cards like Mutagenic Growth, Might of Old Krosa, and Become Immense to pump them up for lethal damage. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing to ensure your infect creatures can get through. Inkmoth Nexus is used as an alternate win condition, and the deck runs a low land count to maximize the number of spells and threats it can play each turn.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to quickly reduce your own life total and put out a massive Death's Shadow creature, while using spells like Become Immense and Temur Battle Rage to finish off your opponent quickly. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and removal through Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support the variety of colors needed for the creatures and spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents while also creating value through cards like Blade Splicer and Restoration Angel. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's game plan while beating them down with aggressive creatures. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and Collected Company can help dig for key creatures. The mana base includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Gavony Township to further disrupt opponents while also providing flexibility in gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing high-value creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant alongside disruption spells such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to apply early pressure and control the opponent's hand. With powerful Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock with aggressive creatures. The mana base is designed to support all the necessary colors to cast the spells efficiently and consistently.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast and aggressive creatures, artifacts, and land to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By equipping creatures with Cranial Plating and using cards like Galvanic Blast to remove threats, the deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize. Utilizing mana acceleration from Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, as well as the versatility of cards like Vault Skirge and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly while utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Path to Exile to control the opponent's board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan to secure a quick victory. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the Eldrazi creatures while still allowing for consistent plays throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponents' spells, removing threats from the board, and utilizing cards that draw additional resources. It aims to maintain board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats like Celestial Colonnade and planeswalkers like Gideon Jura. The deck's versatility allows it to handle a variety of threats and strategies, making it a strong choice for players who enjoy playing a more reactive and controlling style of gameplay in the Modern format.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up quickly with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek, and then cheat out a Primeval Titan or two onto the battlefield using Through the Breach. Once Primeval Titan enters the battlefield, it can search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and mountains to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Anger of the Gods and Lightning Bolt to control the board until the combo is assembled. The deck aims to quickly combo off and overwhelm the opponent with powerful Valakut triggers.

The key concept of the deck is to quickly assemble the Ad Nauseam combo by using cards like Pentad Prism and Lotus Bloom to generate mana, Angel's Grace to prevent losing the game, and Ad Nauseam to draw the entire deck. The win condition is to either use Laboratory Maniac to win the game on the spot or to use Lightning Storm to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to win before the opponent can disrupt the combo with counterspells or removal spells.

The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and combo off with Amulet of Vigor, Azusa, Lost but Seeking, and Primeval Titan to tutor for lands such as Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion and Slayers' Stronghold to give Primeval Titan haste and double strike, allowing for a deadly attack. The deck also utilizes Hive Mind to force opponents to copy spells such as Pact of Negation, Slaughter Pact, and Summoner's Pact, putting them in a difficult position. The main focus is on assembling the combo pieces efficiently to quickly win the game.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Death's Shadow, and Gnarlwood Dryad to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Gitaxian Probe, Mishra's Bauble, and Street Wraith, the deck can lower its own life total to pump up Death's Shadow and trigger abilities. With cards like Become Immense and Temur Battle Rage, the deck can deal large amounts of damage in a single turn, allowing for quick and powerful victories. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Dismember to disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, and then quickly play out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large, evasive threats while disrupting their game plan with cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Spellskite. The deck also includes some control elements with Path to Exile for removal and Ancient Stirrings for card selection. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a large board of Elf creatures and utilize their abilities to generate mana quickly. This enables the player to cast powerful spells like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to search for key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes cards like Ezuri, Renegade Leader to buff the entire team and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and efficient combo strategy. The mana base is designed to support the Elf creatures and ensure a smooth mana curve throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to use creatures with infect ability, such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with pump spells like Vines of Vastwood and Might of Old Krosa to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Become Immense and Mutagenic Growth to increase the power of the creatures and potentially finish the game in a single turn. The inclusion of Noble Hierarch helps to ramp up mana for faster plays, while cards like Gitaxian Probe and Sleight of Hand provide card advantage and selection.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate help control the board, allowing the deck to keep up the pressure. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck looks to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to come out ahead in the match.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kalitas to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. The inclusion of Liliana of the Veil provides additional control elements, while Blood Moon can shut down certain strategies. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure and control the game tempo to secure a victory.
